item.title: Behind R Ashwin's Shock Retirement, The Role Coach Gautam Gambhir Played - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Behind R Ashwin's Shock Retirement, The Role Coach Gautam Gambhir Played

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

R Ashwin's unexpected retirement announcement shocked cricket fans worldwide as he declared his exit from international cricket after the Brisbane Test, leaving many questions unanswered about his decision.

  • Ashwin expressed concerns about his role in the team and sought guarantees from selectors about being in the playing XI before traveling to Australia.
  • Following a disappointing series against New Zealand, Ashwin's mindset shifted as he faced setbacks, including being overlooked for the Perth Test in favor of Washington Sundar.
  • Despite assurances from captain Rohit Sharma, Ashwin remained third in team hierarchy, impacting his decision to retire.
  • Gautam Gambhir, the head coach, confirmed Ashwin was not the preferred choice spinner going forward.
  • At 38, Ashwin reflected on his career after 537 Test wickets, realizing he wouldn't endure through the next World Test Championship cycle.
“What doesn't change is the respect, recognition, and records R Ashwin has earned over the years.”

Ashwin's retirement marks a significant transition for the Indian cricket team, showcasing the changing dynamics and the blend of respect for a veteran's capabilities.

item.title: Sundar, Ashwin, Jadeja: How spin-bowling switcheroo possibly hastened R Ashwin's retirement - The Times of India
item.description:
Impact of Spin-Bowling Decisions on R Ashwin's Retirement

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement announcement has left the cricket world in shock, stemming from his exclusion in favor of other spinners during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Ashwin was not selected for the opener at Perth, a move that likely contributed to his retirement decision.
  • Rohit Sharma's leadership return favored Ashwin's initial inclusion in the playing eleven for subsequent tests.
  • Ultimately, Ashwin’s non-selection in Brisbane prompted his early departure from the series.
  • Speculation surrounds the reasons for his sudden retirement, with hints that he had considered it for several months.
“If I am not needed right now in the series, then I am better off saying goodbye to the game.” - Rohit Sharma

The circumstances leading to Ashwin's retirement raise questions about team strategy and player dynamics, leaving fans eager for clarity regarding his decision.

item.title: 'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description:
'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, recognized as one of cricket's premier fast bowlers, recently surpassed Kapil Dev's record to become India's top Test wicket-taker in Australia.

  • Bumrah has overcome significant back issues to excel in cricket, achieving a record of 53 wickets in Australia.
  • He was the player of the match in India's first Test victory in Perth, claiming nine wickets in total.
  • His average of 10.90 makes him the standout bowler of the series, well ahead of his Australian counterparts.
  • Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting praised Bumrah, calling him India's greatest fast bowler across all formats.
  • Travis Head noted Bumrah's potential to be one of the greatest fast bowlers ever.
  • Despite questions regarding the legality of his bowling action, legends like Greg Chappell have defended him.
  • Bumrah's unique bowling technique has consistently troubled batters and earned admiration from players around the world.
“He is definitely India’s greatest fast bowler.” - Ricky Ponting
“Jasprit is probably going to go down as one of the greatest fast bowlers to play the game.” - Travis Head

Bumrah's remarkable achievements and comeback after injury solidify his legacy as a key player in Indian cricket history.

item.title: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma Contradict On Ashwin's Retirement Plan, Confusion Erupts - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Uncertain Future, Knee Struggle, Family's Advice: Behind R Ashwin's Last-Minute Retirement Call - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin's Surprising Retirement During Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: March 9, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin has made the unexpected decision to retire during the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy, citing knee issues and uncertainty about his future with the Indian Test team as key factors.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement at age 38, after playing 106 Tests and taking 537 wickets.
  • His decision was influenced by persistent knee problems and lack of consistent selection.
  • Ashwin informed his family of his retirement decision the night before, which came as a shock to many teammates.
  • His last match was against Australia in Adelaide, where he took one wicket in the pink-ball Test.
“Ashwin's injury struggles and his non-selection in overseas conditions contributed to this abrupt decision.”

This retirement marks the end of an illustrious career for one of India's leading spinners, leaving many to reflect on his significant contributions to the game.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin contradicts Rohit Sharma shortly after retirement; 'unusual' behaviour irks India legend - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin Contradicts Rohit Sharma Post Retirement Amid Controversy

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a surprising turn of events, Ravichandran Ashwin left for India after announcing his retirement, contradicting statements made by captain Rohit Sharma regarding his departure.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement after the third Test against Australia in Brisbane, becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests.
  • Rohit Sharma initially stated Ashwin would depart following a day of the announcement, but Ashwin chose to leave immediately.
  • Sunil Gavaskar expressed concern over Ashwin's mid-tour exit, citing potential issues with team dynamics and planning for upcoming matches.
“At the end of the day, the person himself knows whether he's got it in him. You could possibly have the ability; it may still be there. But mentally, you may not want to be in the battle.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Ashwin's abrupt decision to leave has raised questions about player commitments during international tours and the impact on team strategy moving forward.

item.title: Real Madrid 3-0 Pachuca (18 Dec, 2024) Game Analysis - ESPN India
item.description:
Real Madrid 3-0 Pachuca (18 Dec, 2024) Game Analysis

Date: 18 Dec, 2024   |   Source: ESPN (IN)

Real Madrid won the Intercontinental Cup after defeating Pachuca 3-0 in a dominant performance at the Lusail Stadium in Qatar, securing their ninth global title.

  • Real Madrid scored three goals, with Kylian Mbappé, Rodrygo, and Vinícius Júnior finding the net.
  • The match showcased Madrid's control despite Pachuca's attempts at counter-attacks.
  • Vinícius assisted Mbappé's opening goal before Rodrygo's stunning second.
  • Vinícius completed the scoring with a penalty in the 83rd minute.
  • Carlo Ancelotti set a record as Madrid's most decorated coach following the win.
"I'm happy with today's game, and with [winning The Best] yesterday, which was very special," Vinicius said.

This victory adds another trophy to Real Madrid's storied history and emphasizes their dominance in international competitions.

item.title: Real Madrid player ratings vs Pachuca: Jude Bellingham, you are out of this world! Midfield genius & Vinicius Jr inspire Intercontinental Cup final win as Kylian Mbappe returns with a bang - Goal.com
item.description:
Real Madrid player ratings vs Pachuca: Jude Bellingham, you are out of this world!

Publication Date: Not specified Source: GOAL

Real Madrid claimed a resounding 3-0 victory over Pachuca in the Intercontinental Cup final, marking a historic moment for manager Carlo Ancelotti.

  • Real Madrid secured the Intercontinental Cup title in Qatar.
  • Carlo Ancelotti became the club’s most successful manager with this win.
  • Madrid scored their first goal in the 37th minute after a well-executed play by Jude Bellingham and Vinicius Jr assisting Kylian Mbappe.
  • Rodrygo added the second goal shortly after halftime, showcasing superb skill.
  • Vinicius Jr sealed the win with a penalty late in the game.
“It was a memorable evening for Carlo Ancelotti, whose 15th major trophy with Los Blancos sees him become the club’s most successful manager ever.”

Real Madrid's dominating performance highlights their strength and depth, setting a high standard for future competitions.

item.title: South Africa vs Pakistan Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 2nd ODI match between SA vs PAK? - CricTracker
item.description:
South Africa vs Pakistan Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 2nd ODI match

Date: December 19, 2024
Source: CricTracker

In the second ODI match, South Africa will face Pakistan at Newlands. The Proteas, opting to bat first after winning the toss, set a sub-competitive total with Heinrich Klaasen scoring an impressive 86. Pakistan struggled initially but Saim Ayub and Salman Agha led a strong comeback.

Key Points:

  • South Africa scored a sub-competitive total led by Klaasen's 86 runs.
  • Pakistan's bowlers, particularly Salman Agha, performed well.
  • Saim Ayub scored a century, contributing to Pakistan's successful chase.
  • The match will be broadcasted live on Sports18 Network and Jio Cinema.
  • Early movement expected for pacers due to pitch conditions.
“South Africa to win the match.”

Conclusion: The match is expected to be competitive, with South Africa having a slight edge based on recent performances.

item.title: Matthew Hayden honours R Ashwin’s legacy with heartfelt praise post-retirement - The Times of India
item.description:
Matthew Hayden honours R Ashwin’s legacy with heartfelt praise post-retirement

Publication Date: [Not available] Source: Times of India

Matthew Hayden praised R Ashwin's cricketing skills following his retirement from international cricket, calling him a 'smart cricketer.' Ashwin's decision to retire surprised many, particularly after an emotional moment with Virat Kohli during the Brisbane Test match.

  • Hayden commended Ashwin's strategic thinking and dedication to the game.
  • Ashwin's retirement announcement came alongside Indian captain Rohit Sharma.
  • He played 106 Test matches, taking 537 wickets, including achieving remarkable records in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Yeah, I think Sunny described him really well--a very smart cricketer... But I personally want to wish Ashwin a wonderful retirement,” Hayden stated.

Ashwin is recognized for his incredible records and contributions to cricket, making him a standout player whose achievements will be benchmarks for future generations.

item.title: How can India still qualify for 2025 WTC Final - The Times of India
item.description:
India's Path to the 2025 World Test Championship Final

Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

The Indian cricket team remains in contention for the 2025 World Test Championship (WTC) Final even after a draw against Australia at Gabba. To secure their spot, India must win both remaining Tests in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • India is currently ranked third in the WTC standings.
  • To guarantee qualification, India must achieve victories in both remaining Tests.
  • They need Australia to suffer losses in their matches against Sri Lanka for a better chance.
  • Different scenarios have been outlined for India's qualification based on their performance and Australia's results.
“If India lose the series 1-2, they will finish with a percentage points of 51.75, effectively ruling them out of contention for the WTC final.”

The stakes are high for India as they aim to secure their place in the WTC Final through a combination of their performance and other teams' results.

item.title: How Can India Qualify For WTC Final After Brisbane Test Ends In A Draw - News18
item.description:
How Can India Qualify For WTC Final After Brisbane Test Ends In A Draw

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

The third Test of the ongoing five-match Test series between India and Australia ended in a draw, greatly impacting India's chances of qualifying for the World Test Championship (WTC) 2025 final.

  • The match took place at The Gabba in Brisbane from December 14 to 18, but only 2.1 overs of play were possible due to rain.
  • India currently maintains its No. 3 position in the ICC WTC 2023-25 points table.
  • India must win the next two Tests in the series to have a chance at qualifying for the WTC final.
  • South Africa is in the running for the WTC final as well, needing specific outcomes in their upcoming series against Pakistan.
“India will qualify for the WTC final at Lord's next year if Rohit Sharma’s men beat Australia in the next two Tests.”

India’s performance in the upcoming tests is crucial for their qualification hopes, while they also need Sri Lanka to perform against Australia in future matches.

item.title: Chess In India, Admiration For MS Dhoni And More: World Chess Champion D Gukesh Opens Up To NDTV - NDTV Sports
item.description:
World Chess Champion D Gukesh Reflects on Victory and Chess Popularity in India

Publication Date: N/A Source: NDTV

World Chess Champion Gukesh Dommaraju shares his thoughts on his recent victory against Ding Liren and speaks about the growing popularity of chess in India, drawing parallels with cricket legend MS Dhoni.

  • Gukesh did not expect to win the final game but capitalized on an opponent's mistake.
  • He credited former cricket coach Paddy Upton for his mental preparation.
  • Gukesh expressed happiness at the increasing interest in chess among youth in India.
  • He admires MS Dhoni for his calmness under pressure and sees a similarity in their approaches.
  • Gukesh is preparing to compete against Magnus Carlsen in an upcoming tournament.
“I could see a lot of kids taking interest in the game... I hope it grows and we become stronger and stronger every day.” - Gukesh

Gukesh's insights highlight the interconnection between sports, mental preparation, and the evolution of popular games in India.

item.title: D Gukesh Reveals Why He Went Bungee Jumping After Becoming Youngest World Chess Champion | Exclusive - News18
item.description:
D Gukesh Reveals Why He Went Bungee Jumping After Becoming Youngest World Chess Champion | Exclusive

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: CNN-News18

D Gukesh celebrated his historic victory by bungee jumping, a pact he made with his trainer during the championship.

  • At only 18 years old, D Gukesh became the youngest world chess champion.
  • He defeated Ding Liren after an intense 14-game match.
  • The idea for bungee jumping came during a beach stroll with his trainer.
  • Emphasis on mental and physical preparation helped him in this prestigious match.
“This whole year was right from this time I qualified for the candidates. It was, I mean, this journey has been beautiful.” - D Gukesh

This victory not only highlights D Gukesh's talent but also his unique approach to celebrating success.

item.title: ‘Bumrah was guiding Akash Deep, resolve shown by Rahul-Jadeja…’: Gavaskar's point-blank assessment of IND's Gabba show - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gavaskar Praises India’s Resilience in Gabba Test Draw

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Gabba Test ended in a draw, showcasing India's determination led by Bumrah and the resilience of the team, especially from young players during their first Test in Australia.

  • Gavaskar highlighted Bumrah’s role in guiding Akash Deep in their 10th wicket partnership.
  • Despite Australia’s strong position after their innings, rain played a crucial role in preserving the draw.
  • The half-centuries from KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja were pivotal for India's morale.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of the fight displayed by the Indian batters for the remaining Tests.
“The resolve shown by KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja will augur well for the remaining two Tests.” - Sunil Gavaskar

This performance by India has kept the series competitive with two Tests remaining, and the players' morale is boosted heading into the next matches.

item.title: "When Rahul Dravid, Sachin Tendulkar Left...": Ashwin's Emotional 'Transition' Speech To Team India - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ashwin's Emotional Farewell Speech to Team India

Publication Date: December 18, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin addressed his teammates in a heartfelt speech following his retirement from international cricket. This moment came after the third Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and was filled with emotions as he recounted his journey and relationships formed over the years.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • He expressed that his emotional farewell felt similar to earlier transitions in Indian cricket, particularly after legends like Rahul Dravid and Sachin Tendulkar left.
  • He emphasized the value of the relationships he has built with his teammates.
  • Ashwin retires having taken 765 wickets across all formats, making him India's second-highest international wicket-taker.
“I'm leaving behind some of my dear teammates. Every passing year... I've felt how much more I value their relationship.” - Ravichandran Ashwin

In conclusion, Ashwin leaves behind a legacy of excellence in cricket and continues to cherish the relationships and the sport beyond his international career.

item.title: Just few hours after announcing retirement, R Ashwin flies out of Brisbane - The Times of India
item.description:
Just few hours after announcing retirement, R Ashwin flies out of Brisbane

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times of India

Hours after announcing his retirement from all forms of international cricket, R Ashwin was at the airport ready to fly home, having received a heartfelt send-off from the Indian cricket team.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement quickly after the post-match press conference.
  • The team could not organize a proper farewell gathering due to time constraints.
  • Emotional scenes were witnessed in the dressing room as Ashwin delivered a farewell speech.
  • He received a special jersey from the Australian captain Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon.
"The international cricketer in me might have come to an end but the cricket nut in me will never come to an end. I will be looking forward to each one of your performances and all the very best."

His retirement marks the end of an illustrious career spanning over 14 years in international cricket.

item.title: 'About Shami, it's high time…': Rohit Sharma drops verdict on India pacer's future, says 'there have been complaints' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Discusses Mohammed Shami's Return to the Team

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent press conference, Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma provided an update regarding fast bowler Mohammed Shami's rehabilitation and potential return to the team.

  • Shami has been recovering from an ankle injury sustained during the 2023 ODI World Cup, resulting in a surgery that sidelined him for nearly a year.
  • Shami has begun playing domestic cricket and is set to compete in the Vijay Hazare Trophy for Bengal starting December 21.
  • Rohit expressed the need for guidance from the National Cricket Academy (NCA) regarding Shami's condition as there are concerns about his knee.
  • Rohit emphasized that they would not take risks with Shami's fitness, reflecting on the experience of Josh Hazlewood's premature return from injury.
  • The Indian captain mentioned that while Shami is bowling well in domestic matches, a full clearance has not yet been given by the BCCI.
"There is no way we want to take that chance unless we are 100 percent, 200 percent sure, we're not going to take any risk." - Rohit Sharma

The uncertainty surrounding Mohammed Shami's return is causing concern as fans and selectors await clarity from the NCA.

item.title: ‘About Shami, it’s high time…’: Rohit drops verdict on India pacer’s future in big ‘there have been complaints’ remark - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Discusses Mohammed Shami's Future Amid Injury Concerns

Dec 18, 2024 - Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma provided an update on Mohammed Shami's situation, emphasizing the need for clarity from the National Cricket Academy regarding Shami's rehabilitation progress.

  • Shami has been out of action since the 2023 ODI World Cup final due to an ankle injury and subsequent surgery.
  • He is set to play in the Vijay Hazare Trophy for Bengal starting December 21.
  • Rohit Sharma stressed the importance of ensuring Shami is fully fit before his return to international cricket, citing complaints about Shami's knee.
  • The Indian pace attack has been led by Jasprit Bumrah in Shami's absence.
  • Shami's return was initially anticipated during home Tests against Bangladesh and New Zealand, but recurring knee issues have delayed it.
“About Shami, I think it's high time somebody from NCA talks about him, where he is rehabbing.” - Rohit Sharma

The importance of player fitness is paramount as India navigates their cricketing schedule, with key players like Shami being crucial for future matches.

item.title: Injured Maharaj and Mulder included in South Africa squad for Tests against Pakistan - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
South Africa Includes Injured Maharaj and Mulder in Test Squad Against Pakistan

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

South Africa has included Keshav Maharaj and Wiaan Mulder in their Test squad for the upcoming matches against Pakistan, despite their injuries.

  • Keshav Maharaj suffered a groin strain before the first ODI and will undergo a scan to assess his condition.
  • Wiaan Mulder is recovering from a broken finger and is expected to undergo another scan soon.
  • Test coach Shukri Conrad will wait for the scan results before making any squad replacements.
  • South Africa has included two uncapped seam bowlers, Corbin Bosch and Kwena Maphaka, as cover.
  • The first Test is at SuperSport Park, a venue where South Africa has only lost one Test in the last ten years.
“Kesh is obviously one of the senior players in the side. He is a great sounding board. He's got a huge amount of experience and he's such a calming influence in the change room as well.” - Shukri Conrad

The Proteas aim to secure a spot in the World Test Championship final, with matches scheduled on Boxing Day and for the New Year’s Test at Newlands.

item.title: BBL 2024-2025: Match 5, REN vs HUR Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between REN vs HUR? - CricTracker
item.description:
BBL 2024-2025: Match 5 Prediction - Melbourne Renegades vs Hobart Hurricanes

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: CricTracker

The Melbourne Renegades will face the Hobart Hurricanes in the fifth match of the BBL 2024-25 season at GMHBA Stadium in Geelong. This match marks the Hurricanes' season opener while the Renegades look to bounce back from their previous defeat.

  • Match Details: REN vs HUR, December 19, 2024, 1:45 PM IST
  • Venue: GMHBA Stadium, Geelong
  • Broadcast: Star Sports Network and Disney+ Hotstar
  • Previous Performances: Renegades lost their first match against Sydney Sixers, while Hurricanes had an average last season.
  • Pitch Report: Historically favorable for first batting teams with an average first score of 141.
  • Head-to-Head: Out of 19 matches, Renegades won 8 and Hurricanes won 11.
The prediction suggests that the team batting first is likely to win, depending on the toss results.

Based on analysis, the author recommends keeping an eye on the performance of Tim Seifert and Nathan Ellis in this match.

item.title: She Is Most Googled Person In India In 2024, Chirag Paswan Is Third - NDTV
item.description:
Vinesh Phogat Named Most Googled Person in India for 2024

Publication Date: June 9, 2024 Source: NDTV

According to a Google Trends report, Olympian wrestler Vinesh Phogat emerged as the most Googled person in India in 2024, reflecting a year marked by significant highs and lows in her career.

  • Vinesh Phogat, an Olympian wrestler and newly-elected Congress MLA, topped the list of most searched Indians.
  • The second most-searched individual was Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, followed by Chirag Paswan in third place.
  • Searches for Kumar and Paswan peaked during the Lok Sabha election counting day.
  • Phogat experienced a shocking disqualification at the Paris Olympics but rebounded with victory in the Haryana elections.
  • Cricketer Hardik Pandya and Pawan Kalyan, an actor-turned-politician, also featured prominently in the searches.
  • Other notable entries included model Poonam Pandey and badminton star Laksha Sena.
“This year has been a journey of heartbreak and new beginnings,” Vinesh Phogat on her tumultuous year.

The trends indicate a blend of sports, politics, and entertainment defining the public's search interests in India for 2024.

item.title: Cheteshwar Pujara Gives Brutal Verdict On Rohit Sharma's Dismal Form: "He Should Have..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Pujara Critiques Rohit Sharma's Batting Position Amid Struggles

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Cheteshwar Pujara has commented on Rohit Sharma's performance issues during the Test series against Australia, emphasizing the challenges posed by batting in the middle order.

  • Pujara highlights Rohit's poor shot selection and mental pressure due to a lack of runs.
  • Rohit has been dismissed six times by Pat Cummins in 12 innings this series.
  • The captain has shifted from an opening role to batting at No. 6, adding to his struggles.
  • Pujara believes that adjusting to a new batting position has affected Rohit’s performance.
“He should have defended that ball, allowed the ball to come to him rather than going for that ball.” - Cheteshwar Pujara

Pujara's insights shed light on the importance of batting order and its impact on performance, particularly for experienced players like Rohit Sharma.
